results.title: The Adventures of Buzz Boy & Buzz Girl
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This animated short depicts the adventures between an evil bee and super hero insects. Dr. Bee has hypnotised Buzz Boy to steal for him, after poisoning a peanut and jelly sandwich. Buzz Girl finds out the truth and informs Buzz Boy. Together they set out in search of Dr.Bee. They find him and are caught up in a high speed chase which eventuates in Dr.Bee crashing into the side of a skyscraper.

group_siblings.title: Barry and the psycho doorstop salesman
The good, the bad and the animated

results.title: The Great Canadian train ride
results.brief_description: In 1955 the Canadian Pacific Railway inaugurated the ‘Canadian’, a new train designed to offer the ultimate in rail luxury. It was then and remains today one of the longest train journeys in the world. VIA Rail took on the daunting task of restoring all of the original lounge Park Cars, the observation dome cars and the dining and sleeping cars. The restored cars are now in service on the northern route of the Super Continental. Doug Jones boards the train in Toronto and documents its journey to Vancouver across Canada. A history of the Canadian Pacific Railway is given, as well as a behind the scenes look at the operations of the train. Doug Jones also looks at tourist destinations along the way.

results.title: The Grass is singing
results.creator_credit: Michael Raeburn, Mark Forstater, Svenska filminstitutet and Chibote Ltd
results.brief_description: Set against the overwhelming African bush, Karen Black as Mary Turner plays a desperate woman searching for security and love. Unable to come to terms with herself or the land she lives in, Mary accepts a marriage proposal from farmer John Thaw, rather than remain single in a big city. But this is not the escape she hoped it to be. Based on the novel by Doris Lessing.

results.title: The Great Bookie Robbery
results.creator_credit: Marcus Cole, Mark Joffe, Ian Bradley and PBL Productions
results.brief_description: Three part mini series made in Melbourne in the late 1980s about the real life robbery of the Victoria Club in 1972. Several million dollars in cash was taken in a daring but meticulously planned armed hold up. As well as a stellar cast of well-known Australian actors, the city of Melbourne also fares well as a tough town underworld is exposed. This series dramatises the police investigation and details the more personal lives of the criminals including how the crime affects their partners, wives and family. Screenplay by Phillip Cornford. Photographed by Ellery Ryan. Music by David Skinner. Cast includes: John Bach, Catherine Wilkin, Gary Day, Bruno Lawrence, Scott Burgess, Andy Anderson, Gary Sweet, Candy Raymond, Madeline Blackwell, George Spartels, Ray Meagher, Paul Sonkkila, Frank Gallacher, Dennis Miller, Rebecca Rigg and Rebecca Gibney.

results.title: The Great Canadian shield
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The rock of the great Canadian Shield was formed two billion years ago. Now its many minerals—gold, nickel, copper, mica, feldspar, iron and magnesium—are mined as essential ingredients in Canadian industry.

results.title: The Great artesian basin
results.creator_credit: Tim Sullivan, Ron Saunders and Filmhouse
results.brief_description: This film explains the geological process whereby the Great Artesian Basin was formed. It explains how artesian wells function.

results.title: The Grapes of Wrath
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Darryl F. Zanuck, Nunnally Johnson and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Adaptation of John Steinbeck’s famous novel. The dramatic story of the Joad family and their migration to California from their dust-bowl farm in Oklahoma during the Depression. An observance of America during a difficult era, the film reveals considerable compassion for poor, honest people struggling for dignity against seemingly insurmountable odds. Stars Henry Fonda, Jane Darwell, John Carradine and Charley Grapewin.

results.title: The Gourmet's Dilemma
results.creator_credit: Robert V Jenkins, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
A light hearted yet serious educational production highlighting to new migrants the strict quarantine precautions necessary against Foot and Mouth disease and other animal diseases being introduced into Australia. The film was originally presented with the options of Greek or Italian narration, we follow Nino and his family’s passage to Australia.
Source: NFSA Film Australia Collection

results.title: The Goonies
results.creator_credit: Richard Donner, Harvey Bernhard and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: When a group of greedy developers decide to demolish the headquarters of the Goonies- a group of adventurous youngsters, it seems that the gang will have to disband. By pure coincidence they they encounter a 17th century pirate map and set out on an adventure to locate the treasure and raise the necessary money to save the property. It quickly becomes apparent that they aren’t the only people interested in the treasure, when they cross paths with a group of criminals. The Goonies start to live up to their adventurous mission more than ever when they enter a fabulous subterranean world and are forced into a series of events that could mean the difference between life, death, and the future of their home. Cast includes Sean Astin, Josh Brolin, Jeff Cohen, Corey Feldman and Martha Plimpton.
